CLS201.name: Introduction to Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS201.description: Chicano/Latino studies as an academic field of research and scholarship. Arts, communications, literature and the social sciences.

CLS490.name: Independent Study in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CLS490.description: Guided research and reading in Chicano/Latino studies. Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
CLS490.prerequisite: CLS 201 or concurrently or approval of department

CLS492.name: Chicano and Latino Studies: Research, Theory and Practice
CLS492.description: Foundational fieldwork by historians, social scientists, artists and activists. Survey of the development of CLS. Analysis of Chicano and Latino social phenomenon.
CLS492.prerequisite: (CLS 201) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

CLS493.name: Internship in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CLS493.description: Application of course work in Chicano/Latino studies through work experience in public, private, or nonprofit agency or organization in the U.S. whose goals and activities address Chicano/Latino issues.

CLS810.name: Historiography and Social Science Methods in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS810.description: Historical, political, economic, and cultural approaches to the study of peoples of Indo-Afro-Hispano origins in the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean.

CLS811.name: Literary and Cultural Theory in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS811.description: Comparative global examination of experiences of peoples of Indo-Afro-Hispano origin in the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean. Exploration of intersecting experiences of race and ethnicity.

CLS893E.name: Readings in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS893E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CLS893E.description: Directed research and readings on selected topics in collaboration with Chicano/Latino Studies faculty member.

CLS894.name: Fieldwork in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CLS894.description: Social action research on selected topic in collaboration with a Chicano/Latino Studies faculty member in area of interest.

CLS896.name: Seminar in Chicano/Latino Studies
CLS896.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CLS896.description: Selected topics in Chicano/Latino studies. Theories, issues, methodological innovations.
CLS896.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Chicano/Latino Studies major. Approval of department.

CLS999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CLS999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CLS999.restrictions: Open to graduate students. Approval of department.
